alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 6:29PM MDT until July 04 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTY... At 629 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Granite Springs Reservoir to 7 miles east of Crystal Lake Campground to near Natural Fort, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Crystal Lake Reservoir, Granite Springs Reservoir, Federal, Crystal Lake Campground and Granite Springs Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 339 and 357. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
